title: [Large-Scale] Blended Learning Course on Cardiovascular Pharmacotherapy

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and introductory cardiovascular diseases
context.additional_context: Emphasizing work relevance for office/administrative professionals, with mandatory use of digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more drug action mechanisms according to the pathophysiology of cardiovascular diseases.
In a blended learning environment, learners can complete online modules 100% and apply knowledge by asking two or more questions during real-time discussions.

Through a two-week project-based assessment, learners analyze three real patient cases (one internal medicine, one surgery, one emergency) and submit treatment plans including diagnosis (with ICD-10 codes), three or more treatment goals, a five-step intervention plan, and two measurable evaluation criteria following institutional standard templates. Submitted plans must achieve an "Excellent" grade (90+ points) in at least four of the five institutional rubric items (accuracy, completeness, clinical relevance, evidence-based approach, practicality).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
